game

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Vector

  • public class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple geometric vector class (a la Point), which allows doubles for its fields

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double TOLERANCE
      Tolerance to consider two vector components equal.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector()
      Constructor: a vector <0,0>.
      Vector(double x, double y)
      Constructor: a vector .
      Vector(Vector v)
      Constructor: a vector with same values as v.

      • mult

        public Vector mult(double s)
        Multiply both of this vector's components by s and return this Vector.

      • invert

        public Vector invert()
        Invert both of this' components - change this vector to <1/x, 1/y> -- and returns this Vector. Precondition: the x and y components are not 0.

      • unit

        public Vector unit()
        Make this vector have length 1, with the same direction, and Return this Vector.

      • dot

        public static double dot(Vector a,
         Vector b)
        Return the dot product of a and b/

      • dot

        public double dot(Vector b)
        Return the dot product of this Vector and b.

      • cross

        public static double cross(Vector a,
           Vector b)
        Return the cross product of a and b. Because vectors are 2-d, the return is a vector of the form <0, 0, z> So a 1-D vector.

      • cross

        Return the cross product of this and b.

        public static double radAngle(Vector a,
              Vector b)
        Return the angle between a and b, in radians. Return is in the range 0.. PI

      • radAngle

        public double radAngle(Vector b)
        Returns the angle between this and b, in radians. Return is in the range 0 .. PI

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Hashes a vector based on its components, using function Objects.hash. Round both components to the nearest TOLERANCE
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object ob)
        Return true iff ob is a Vector and is equal to this one. Two vectors are equal if their components are equal - thus checks if they have the same hashcodes, which are built off of their components
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a string representation of this vector: .

        toString in class java.lang.Object
